## Creating a Tag

You can create a tag in Git using the git tag command. Specifying -a will make it an annotated tag, and -m sets the tagging message. Alternatively, if you don`t include -m in the git tag command, you can enter the message in the text editor. 


``` bash
$ git tag -a v0.2.2 -m "my version 0.2.2" 
$ git tag 
v0.1.0 
v0.2.0 
v0.2.1
v0.2.2
```

Once a tag has been created, the git show command will return information from the tag in addition to the commit.  

``` bash
\$ git show v0.2.2 
tag v0.2.2 
Tagger: Someone`s Name [someones.name@email.cc](mailto:someones.name@email.cc){.email} 
Date: Wed Jun 26 11:38:23 2024 -0700

my version 1.4

commit ca82a6dff817ec66f44342007202690a93763949 
Author: Another Person [another.p@email.com](mailto:another.p@email.com){.email} 
Date: Fri Jun 10 12:31:10 2024 -0700

    Change version number
```
